text: Has anyone tried using this with `create-react-app`? CRA supports a `PUBLIC_URL` env variable that is prefixed to all URLs, but not much else in terms of customizing the build process. It seems that HubL's `get_asset_url` requires a specific file as a parameter, so I'm unable to get the prefix right. Any ideas?

You mean for referencing images? That might be a good use case for the new additional Design Manager file types (mentioned on this channel above), then (I believe) you can reference them by a site relative file path. Can't say for sure though, I haven't tried it yet.
You might also be interested in joining the frameworks channel <#CM9UXHWKH|js-frameworks-in-HubSpot-cms>
Is it possible to use SVG's with this feature?

it turns out that we just started looking at what creating a react app on top of the CMS looks like (cc <@U26B530N6>). at this point, i think that using `create-react-app` won’t work super well due to various assumptions it makes.
i think that a simple webpack setup will work better, but we’re just getting started when it comes to looking at how the CLI w/ local dev intersects with webpack and other build tools
<@UJQNNKKHN> at this time, no. The initial file support is for .txt, .md, .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .map, .ttf, .woff, .woff2 files. We do have plans to extend this list, and svg is on that roadmap
Excellent, yeah that would be huge for us... we are planning on implementing a new svg-based icon system, and it would be great to be able to include that in the Design Manager files.

:thumbsup: sounds cool! I will continue to update on changes and new functionality relating to this. In the meantime, always feel free to pass along feedback for the functionality as it relates to the other file types!
I will do that, thanks Will

Thanks, <@U22VBL87M>—looking forward to see what you guys can come up with! Just to give you some extra feedback: Personally, I don't want you to support specific build tools. All I want is to be able to use my existing React components. The only reason I use CRA is because I don't want to maintain my own build configs. I don't have time for that. So the ideal solution for me would be if HubSpot just took care of all that behind the scenes.
